means: 骗取（某物），哄骗（某人干某事）( wheedle的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He wheedled his way into the building , ie got into it by wheedling.
sentence.Network_cn: 他靠花言巧语混进了那所楼房.

sentence.Network_en: An honorable 32 weepie uses none of these 33 ) wheedling 34 ) devices .
sentence.Network_cn: 一部体面的伤感电影用不着这些 花招.
嬷嬷的口气像是在哄孩子了.

list.abs: 甘言蜜语 in... ... 匙叶甘松 spikenard 甜言密语 cheating wheedling;dishonest rhetoric; 心甘 to be willing;to be satisfied.
They finally wheedled the secret out of him ., 他们最终骗他说出了秘密.
She wheedled him into buying her a mink coat ., 她用甜言蜜语诱他买貂皮大衣给她.
The boy wheedled money out of his father ., 那男孩哄骗他父亲的钱.

entry.def: If you say that someone wheedles, you mean that they try to persuade someone to do or give them what they want, for example by saying nice things that they do not mean.

example.ex: Cross decided to beg and wheedle a bit...
example.tran: 克罗斯决定用上点乞求和哄骗。

example.ex: He managed to wheedle his way into the offices.
example.tran: 他连哄带骗地设法进了办公楼。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of urging by means of teasing or flattery

auth_sentence.content: I began to hate his wheedling importunity.
auth_sentence.res_content: I began to hate his wheedling importunity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I began to hate his wheedling importunity.

auth_sentence.content: He sounded like a project manager making excuses, wheedling for a passing grade.
auth_sentence.res_content: He sounded like a project manager making excuses, wheedling for a passing grade.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He sounded like a project manager making excuses, wheedling for a passing grade.

auth_sentence.content: By the time he finished wheedling it down, the house at the beach had become a bar in the basement.
auth_sentence.res_content: By the time he finished wheedling it down, the house at the beach had become a bar in the basement.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: By the time he finished wheedling it down, the house at the beach had become a bar in the basement.
